profileText: A Representative from North Dakota; born in Kintyre, Emmons County, N. Dak., July 1, 1919; graduated from Valley City High School, Valley City, N. Dak., 1936; attended Valley City Teachers College, 1937; United States Army, warrant officer, 1942-1946; mayor of Bismarck, N. Dak., 1950-1954; served on subcommittee of Federal Intergovernmental Relations Committee on Local Government (ex-Hoover Commission); president and treasurer of Gold Seal Co., 1946-1964; vice president, J.M. Dain &Co., Minneapolis investment banking firm; Republican nominee for United States Senate in 1964; delegate, North Dakota Republican convention, 1966; former treasurer of the Republican Party of North Dakota; elected as a Republican to the Ninetieth and to the Ninety-first Congresses (January 3, 1967-January 3, 1971); was not a candidate in 1970 for reelection but was an unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States Senate; Administrator of the Small Business Administration, 1971-1975; Secretary of the Interior, 1975-1977; faculty, University of Wyoming, 1977; died on March 2, 2007, in Bethesda, Md.

researchRecord.description: The Thomas S. Kleppe Papers consist of material from Kleppe's tenure in the United States House of Representatives. Material includes general subject files, North Dakota subject files, committee files, publications, and files related to specific bills before Congress. An addition of 9.5 linear feet was added to the collection in 1977, covering the years 1966-1977, and primarily dealing with Kleppe's tenure as U.S. Secretary of the Interior, including calendar, invitation and regret files, trips, correspondence, and memorabilia. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.
